Instructions:

Welome to our HIT! We are scientists at the University of California San Diego, studying how people see complex shapes.

In this study you will be shown a series of different shapes, and asked to color them in according to how you see different parts of the shape.

For example, look at this shape:

To many people, this shape looks like it could be made from two squares, like this:

In this study, we'll be asking you to color in shapes like this, with different colors for the different parts you identify. As the shapes you'll be working with are a bit more complex, there won't be a single correct way of coloring them in. However, you should try to color them in a way that is obvious to you- so that if you saw the shape again you would probably find the same shapes next time.

As long as different parts are designated by different colors, the specific colors you choose do not matter. These two are equivalent:

But make sure you have selected different colors each time: the two
